intro: Brachistus actinocalyx, commonly known as the star-lobed brachistus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Brachistus actinocalyx is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
